description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.41 (use of the chapel)) pursuant to planning permission reference 164907VAR dated 31/05/2017 for 'Application for a Minor Material Amendment/S73 (Variation of condition 4 approved plans) amendments to the approved detailed landscape scheme of planning permission P/2012/5040 dated 23/07/2013 (amended by PP/2014/5010, PP/2014/4645, P/2014/6390, PP/2015/3928 and 161549VACS) for 'Hybrid planning application: Outline element, with all matters reserved, for the demolition of Windmill Lodge, five buildings containing flats and bowling green pavilion and the re siting of an electricity substation, in conjunction with the erection of three buildings of up to 9 storeys high containing 260 residential units comprising private and affordable units and up to 803sq. metres of floorspace in B1/D1 use and 67 sq. metres of floorspace in A1/A3/B2 use, associated hard and soft landscaping including the removal of trees, surface and basement car parking, cycle parking, servicing, public realm, access and other associated works including the provision of a pedestrian access to Uxbridge Road and alteration to vehicular access on to the hospital access road to the East. Detailed elements for a) the demolition of a single storey extension to the North side and a two storey extension in the south East corner and internal and external alterations in conjunction with the change of use of the listed gatehouse from offices to a retail  unit (Use Class A1), cafe (Use Class A3), concierge accommodation (sui generis) and offices (Use Class B1) b) internal and external alterations in conjunction with the conversion of the listed North House in 6 one-bed flats, with external bin store and cycle store, associated hard and soft landscaping; access, 3 car parking spaces and associated works, c) Erection of a three storey building to provide 4 residential....' Variation to allow the Chapel to be used for a mix of Use Classes E and F.2 (b).
decision_conditions: The application for the approval of reserved matters in respect of the outline element of the development hereby approved must be made to the Local Planning Authority no later than the 22nd July 2016 and the development to which the permission relates must be begun no later than the expiration of two (2) years from the final approval of the reserved matters, or in the case of approval on different dates, the final approval of the last such matter approved.
Reason: To comply with Section 92(2) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by Section 51(2) of the Planning Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.
| The detailed element of the development hereby permitted shall be begun before the 22nd July 2018.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| No part of the outline element of the development (excluding demolition and site preparation works) hereby approved shall commence until the reserved matters as listed below, have been approved by the Local Planning Authority:
o	Access
o	Appearance
o	Landscaping
o	Layout
o	Scale
The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved plans and other supporting documents.

a)            An Overheating and Cooling analysis report with proposed mitigation measures that is compliant with CIBSE Technical Memorandum 59 guidance, and/or TM52 (non-domestic).

b)            details of how all the elements of the full planning application shall incorporate and maintain measures to achieve the following carbon dioxide emission savings according to the approved Energy Statement (Aecom) and Sustainability Statement (Aecom) (including the additional clarifying information):

-              energy saving measures to achieve at least a percentage of 28% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings and 23% in un-regulated carbon dioxide emission (CO2) savings over the compliant Building Regulations Part L 2010 base case.

-              connection to the site wide CHP DH network, unless it can be demonstrated this is not technically feasible to achieve at least a percentage of 45% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings and 36% in unregulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emission savings over the compliant Building Regulations Part L 2010 base case.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure environmentally sustainable development in accordance with policies SI2 and SI3 of the London Plan (2021), and the relevant guidance notes in the GLA Energy Assessment Guidance 2020, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012
